default: (a) una {@item greataxe|phb} o bé (b) qualsevol {@filter martial arma cos a cos|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon=sand}
(a) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes} o bé (b) qualsevol {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
An {@item explorer's pack|phb}, i quatre {@item javelin|phb|javelins}

rows: Unlimited

fluff.name: Bàrbar
entries: A tall human tribesman strides through a blizzard, draped in fur and hefting his axe. He laughs as he charges toward the frost giant who dared poach his people's elk herd.
A half-orc snarls at the latest challenger to her authority over their savage tribe, ready to break his neck with her bare hands as she did to the last six rivals.
Frothing at the mouth, a dwarf slams his helmet into the face of his drow foe, then turns to drive his armored elbow into the gut of another.

These barbarians, different as they might be, are defined by their rage: unbridled, unquenchable, and unthinking fury. More than a mere emotion, their anger is the ferocity of a cornered predator, the unrelenting assault of a storm, the churning turmoil of the sea.

For some, their rage springs from a communion with fierce animal spirits. Others draw from a roiling reservoir of anger at a world full of pain. For every barbarian, rage is a power that fuels not just a battle frenesí but also uncanny reflexes, resilience, and feats of strength.

entries.name: Primal Instinct
entries: People of towns and cities take pride in how their civilized ways set them apart from animals, as if denying one's own nature was a mark of superiority. To a barbarian, though, civilization is no virtue, but a sign of weakness. The strong embrace their animal nature—keen instincts, primal physicality, and ferocious rage. Barbarians are uncomfortable when hedged in by walls and crowds. They thrive in the wilds of their homelands: the tundra, jungle, or grasslands where their tribes live and hunt.

Barbarians come alive in the chaos of combat. They can enter a berserk state where rage takes over, giving them superhuman strength and resilience. A barbarian can draw on this reservoir of fury only a few times without resting, but those few rages are usually sufficient to defeat whatever threats arise.

entries.name: A Life of Danger
entries: Not every member of the tribes deemed "barbarians" by scions of civilized society has the barbarian class. A true barbarian among these people is as uncommon as a skilled fighter in a town, and he or she plays a similar role as a protector of the people and a leader in times of war. Life in the wild places of the world is fraught with peril: rival tribes, deadly weather, and terrifying monsters. Barbarians charge headlong into that danger so that their people don't have to.

Their courage in the face of danger makes barbarians perfectly suited for adventuring. Wandering is often a way of life for their native tribes, and the rootless life of the adventurer is little hardship for a barbarian. Some barbarians miss the close-knit family structures of the tribe, but eventually find them replaced by the bonds formed among the members of their adventuring parties.

entries.name: Creating a Bàrbar
entries: When creating a barbarian character, think about where your character comes from and his or her place in the world. Talk with your DM about an appropriate origin for your barbarian. Did you come from a distant land, making you a stranger in the area of the campaign? Or is the campaign set in a rough-and-tumble frontier where barbarians are common?

What led you to take up the adventuring life? Were you lured to settled lands by the promise of riches? Did you join forces with soldiers of those lands to face a shared threat? Did monsters or an invading horde drive you out of your homeland, making you a rootless refugee? Perhaps you were a prisoner of war, brought in chains to "civilized" lands and only now able to win your freedom. Or you might have been cast out from your people because of a crime you committed, a taboo you violated, or a coup that removed you from a position of authority.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a barbarian quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Força, followed by Constitució. Second, choose the {@background outlander} background.
I have witnessed the indomitable performance of barbarians on the field of battle, and it makes me wonder what force lies at the heart of their rage.

The anger felt by a normal person resembles the rage of a barbarian in the same way that a gentle breeze is akin to a furious thunderstorm. The barbarian's driving force comes from a place that transcends mere emotion, making its manifestation all the more terrible. Whether the impetus for the fury comes entirely from within or from forging a link with a spirit animal, a raging barbarian becomes able to perform supernatural feats of strength and endurance. The outburst is temporary, but while it lasts, it takes over body and mind, driving the barbarian on despite peril and injury, until the last enemy falls.

It can be tempting to play a barbarian character that is a straightforward application of the classic archetype—a brute, and usually a dimwitted one at that, who rushes in where others fear to tread. But not all the barbarians in the world are cut from that cloth, so you can certainly put your own spin on things. Either way, consider adding some flourishes to make your barbarian stand out from all others; see the following sections for some ideas.

entries.name: Personal Totems
entries: Barbarians tend to travel light, carrying little in the way of personal effects or other unnecessary gear. The few possessions they do carry often include small items that have special significance. A personal totem is significant because it has a mystical origin or is tied to an important moment in the character's life—perhaps a remembrance from the barbarian's past or a harbinger of what lies ahead.

A personal totem of this sort might be associated with a barbarian's spirit animal, or might actually be the totem object for the animal, but such a connection is not essential. One who has a bear totem spirit, for instance, could still carry an eagle's feather as a personal totem.
Consider creating one or more personal totems for your character—objects that hold a special link to your character's past or future. Think about how a totem might affect your character's actions.

entries.caption: Personal Totems
rows: A tuft of fur from a solitary wolf that you befriended during a hunt
Three eagle feathers given to you by a wise shaman, who told you they would play a role in determining your fate
A necklace made from the claws of a young cave bear that you slew singlehandedly as a child
A small leather pouch holding three stones that represent your ancestors
A few small bones from the first beast you killed, tied together with colored wool
An egg-sized stone in the shape of your spirit animal that appeared one day in your belt pouch

entries.name: Tattoos
entries: The members of many barbarian clans decorate their bodies with tattoos, each of which represents a significant moment in the life of the bearer or the bearer's ancestors, or which symbolizes a feeling or an attitude. As with personal totems, a barbarian's tattoos might or might not be related to an animal spirit.
Each tattoo a barbarian displays contributes to that individual's identity. If your character wears tattoos, what do they look like, and what do they represent?

entries.caption: Tattoos
rows: The wings of an eagle are spread wide across your upper back.
Etched on the backs of your hands are the paws of a cave bear.
The symbols of your clan are displayed in viny patterns along your arms.
The antlers of an elk are inked across your back.
Images of your spirit animal are tattooed along your weapon arm and hand.
The eyes of a wolf are marked on your back to help you see and ward off evil spirits.

entries.name: Superstitions
entries: Barbarians vary widely in how they understand life. Some follow gods and look for guidance from those deities in the cycles of nature and the animals they encounter. These barbarians believe that spirits inhabit the plants and animals of the world, and the barbarians look to them for omens and power.

Other barbarians trust only in the blood that runs in their veins and the steel they hold in their hands. They have no use for the invisible world, instead relying on their senses to hunt and survive like the wild beasts they emulate.
Both of these attitudes can give rise to superstitions. These beliefs are often passed down within a family or shared among the members of a clan or a hunting group.
If your barbarian character has any superstitions, were they ingrained in you by your family, or are they the result of personal experience?

entries.caption: Superstition
rows: If you disturb the bones of the dead, you inherit all the troubles that plagued them in life.
Never trust a wizard. They're all devils in disguise, especially the friendly ones.
Dwarves have lost their spirits, and are almost like the undead. That's why they live underground.
Magical things bring trouble. Never sleep with a magic object within ten feet of you.
When you walk through a graveyard, be sure to wear silver, or a ghost might jump into your body.
If an elf looks you in the eyes, she's trying to read your thoughts.

subclass.name: Path of the Guerrers del Tótem
subclassFeatures: Path of the Guerrers del Tótem|Bàrbar||Guerrers del Tótem||3
Aspect of the Bèstia|Bàrbar||Guerrers del Tótem||6

subclass.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian (UA)
subclassFeatures: Path of the Ancestral Guardian|Bàrbar||Ancestral Guardian (UA)|UABarbarianPrimalPaths|3

subclass.name: Path of the Storm Herald (UA)
subclassFeatures: Path of the Storm Herald|Bàrbar||Storm Herald (UA)|UABarbarianPrimalPaths|3

subclass.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian v2 (UA)
subclassFeatures: Path of the Ancestral Guardian v2|Bàrbar||Ancestral Guardian v2 (UA)|UARevisedSubclasses|3

subclass.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
subclassFeatures: Path of the Ancestral Guardian|Bàrbar||Ancestral Guardian|XGE|3

subclass.name: Path of the Storm Herald
subclassFeatures: Path of the Storm Herald|Bàrbar||Storm Herald|XGE|3

subclass.name: Path of the Wild Soul (UA)
subclassFeatures: Path of the Wild Soul|Bàrbar||Wild Soul (UA)|UABarbarianAndMonk|3

classFeature.name: Fúria
entries: Lluites cada batalla amb una ferocitat primordial. En el teu torn, pots, com a acció bonus, entrar en fúria.
Mentre estiguis en fúria, reps els beneficis següents (si no vesteixes armadura pesada):

items: Tens avantatge a tirades i salvades de Força.
Quan fas un atac armat cos a cos emprant Força, tens un +2 a la tirada de dany. Aquest bonus incrementa amb el teu nivell.
Tens resistència al dany contundent, perforant, i tallant.

entries: Si tens llançament de conjurs, no en pots llançar ni concentrar-te en un mentre estiguis en fúria.

La fúria dura 1 minut. Acaba prematurament: o bé si et quedes {@condition unconscious}; o bé si el teu torn acaba i no has atacat una criatura hostil des del teu torn passat i tampoc has rebut dany; o si decideixes acabar-la en el teu torn com a acció bonus.

Quan hagis entrat en fúria tants cops com el teu nivell de bàrbar, no pots tornar-hi fins que acabis un Descans Llarg. Tens 2 fúries a nivell 1, 3 a nivell 3, 4 a nivell 6, 5 a nivell 12, i 6 a nivell 17.

classFeature.name: Defensa Desvestida
entries: Mentre no vesteixis armadura, la teva CA és 10 + el teu modificador de Destresa + el teu modificador de Constitució. Pots portar escut i seguir emprant aquest tret.

classFeature.name: Sentir el Perill
entries: A nivell 2, desenvolupes un sentit per detectar allò que no està a lloc; això et dona la possibilitat d'escapar de perills. Tens avantatge en salvades de Destresa contra efectes que puguis veure, com ara trampes i conjurs. Per rebre aquest benefici, no pots estar {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, ni {@condition incapacitated}.

classFeature.name: Atac Imprudent
entries: Començant a nivell 2, pots descartar tota estratègia defensiva i lluitar amb una ira desesperada. Quan fas el teu primer atac del teu torn pots decidir Atacar Imprudentment. Això et dona avantatge a impactar amb atacs armats cos a cos que emprin Força durant aquest torn. Tanmateix, tota tirada d'impacte contra tu té avantatge fins el teu proper torn.

classFeature.name: Instints de Supervivència
entries: {@i tret de bàrbar de nivell 2 (substitueix Sentir el Perill)}
Tens competència en 2 habilitats (escull) de: {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill Medicine}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Perception}, o {@skill Survival}.
El teu bonus de competència es suma 2 cops (i no 1) amb les tirades de les habilitats escollides.

classFeature.name: Coneixement Primordial
entries: {@i 3rd-level barbarian {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
Quan arribes al nivell 3 i al 10, reps competència amb una habilitat de les de bàrbar de nivell 1 (escull).

classFeature.name: Sender Primordial
entries: A nivell 3, tries el sender que formarà l'origen de la teva fúria; escull-lo de la llista de senders. La teva elecció t'otorga trets als nivells 3, 6, 10, i 14s.

classFeature.name: Millora de Puntuació de Característica
entries: Quan arribes a nivell 4, pots incrementar en 2 una puntuació de característica, o bé incrementar en 1 dos puntuacions de característica (escull). No pots incrementar cap puntuació de característica per sobre de 20 mitjançant aquest tret.
Si el/la/li MM ho permet, pots no incrementar cap puntuació; a canvi, esculls una {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Competència Versàtil
entries: {@i tret de nivell 4 (augmenta Millora de Puntuació de Característica)}

Quan obtinguis el tret Millora de Puntuació de Característica de la teva classe, pots substituir una de les teves competències d'habilitat (qualsevol; no ha de ser de la teva classe) per una altra de la llista d'habilitats de la teva classe a nivell 1 .
Aquest canvi representa l'atrofia en una de les teves habilitats ja que et centres en una altra.

classFeature.name: Atac Extra
entries: Començant a nivell 5, pots atacar 2 cops (i no 1) quan prenguis l'acció {@action Attack} en el teu torn.

classFeature.name: Moviment Veloç
entries: Començant a nivell 5, la teva velocitat incrementa en 10 peus mentre no vesteixis armadura pesada.

classFeature.name: Braó Instintiu
entries: {@i tret de bàrbar de nivell 5 (substitueix Moviment Veloç)}
Quan una criatura acabi el seu torn a 15 peus de tu pots, com a reacció, acostar-t'hi fins la meitat de la teva velocitat. Aquest moviment no provoca atacs d'oportunitat.

classFeature.name: Tret de Sender
entries: A nivell 6, obténs un tret gràcies al Sender Primordial.

classFeature.name: Instint de Fera
entries: A nivell 7, els teus instints són tan aguts que tens avantatge a tirades d'iniciativa.
A més, si sorprès/a/i a l'inici d'un combat i no estàs {@condition incapacitated}, pots actuar normalment al primer torn, però has d'entrar en fúria abans de tot.

classFeature.name: Braó Instintiu
entries: {@i 7th-level barbarian {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
Quan entres en fúria com a acció bonus pots, immediatament, moure't la meitat de la teva velocitat.

classFeature.name: Millora de Puntuació de Característica
entries: Quan arribes a nivell 8, pots incrementar en 2 una puntuació de característica, o bé incrementar en 1 dos puntuacions de característica (escull). No pots incrementar cap puntuació de característica per sobre de 20 mitjançant aquest tret.
Si el/la/li MM ho permet, pots no incrementar cap puntuació; a canvi, esculls una {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Competència Versàtil
entries: {@i tret de nivell 8 (augmenta Millora de Puntuació de Característica)}

Quan obtinguis el tret Millora de Puntuació de Característica de la teva classe, pots substituir una de les teves competències d'habilitat (qualsevol; no ha de ser de la teva classe) per una altra de la llista d'habilitats de la teva classe a nivell 1 .
Aquest canvi representa l'atrofia en una de les teves habilitats ja que et centres en una altra.

classFeature.name: Brutal Critical (1 die)
entries: Començant a nivell 9, you can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.
This increases to two additional dice a nivell 13 and three additional dice a nivell 17.

classFeature.name: Tret de Sender
entries: A nivell 10, obténs un tret gràcies al Sender Primordial.

classFeature.name: Relentless Rage
entries: Començant a nivell 11, your rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 hit points mentre estiguis en fúria and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitució saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead.
Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10.

classFeature.name: Millora de Puntuació de Característica
entries: Quan arribes a nivell 12, pots incrementar en 2 una puntuació de característica, o bé incrementar en 1 dos puntuacions de característica (escull). No pots incrementar cap puntuació de característica per sobre de 20 mitjançant aquest tret.
Si el/la/li MM ho permet, pots no incrementar cap puntuació; a canvi, esculls una {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Competència Versàtil
entries: {@i tret de nivell 12 (augmenta Millora de Puntuació de Característica)}

Quan obtinguis el tret Millora de Puntuació de Característica de la teva classe, pots substituir una de les teves competències d'habilitat (qualsevol; no ha de ser de la teva classe) per una altra de la llista d'habilitats de la teva classe a nivell 1 .
Aquest canvi representa l'atrofia en una de les teves habilitats ja que et centres en una altra.

classFeature.name: Brutal Critical (2 dice)
entries: A nivell 13, you can roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.
This increases to three additional dice a nivell 17.

classFeature.name: Tret de Sender
entries: A nivell 14, obténs un tret gràcies al Sender Primordial.

classFeature.name: Persistent Rage
entries: Començant a nivell 15, your rage is so fierce that it ends early only if you fall {@condition unconscious} or if you choose to end it.

classFeature.name: Millora de Puntuació de Característica
entries: Quan arribes a nivell 16, pots incrementar en 2 una puntuació de característica, o bé incrementar en 1 dos puntuacions de característica (escull). No pots incrementar cap puntuació de característica per sobre de 20 mitjançant aquest tret.
Si el/la/li MM ho permet, pots no incrementar cap puntuació; a canvi, esculls una {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Competència Versàtil
entries: {@i tret de nivell 16 (augmenta Millora de Puntuació de Característica)}

Quan obtinguis el tret Millora de Puntuació de Característica de la teva classe, pots substituir una de les teves competències d'habilitat (qualsevol; no ha de ser de la teva classe) per una altra de la llista d'habilitats de la teva classe a nivell 1 .
Aquest canvi representa l'atrofia en una de les teves habilitats ja que et centres en una altra.

classFeature.name: Brutal Critical (3 dice)
entries: A nivell 17, you can roll three additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

classFeature.name: Indomitable Might
entries: Començant a nivell 18, if your total for a Força check is less than your Força score, you can use that score in place of the total.

classFeature.name: Millora de Puntuació de Característica
entries: Quan arribes a nivell 19, pots incrementar en 2 una puntuació de característica, o bé incrementar en 1 dos puntuacions de característica (escull). No pots incrementar cap puntuació de característica per sobre de 20 mitjançant aquest tret.
Si el/la/li MM ho permet, pots no incrementar cap puntuació; a canvi, esculls una {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Competència Versàtil
entries: {@i tret de nivell 19 (augmenta Millora de Puntuació de Característica)}

Quan obtinguis el tret Millora de Puntuació de Característica de la teva classe, pots substituir una de les teves competències d'habilitat (qualsevol; no ha de ser de la teva classe) per una altra de la llista d'habilitats de la teva classe a nivell 1 .
Aquest canvi representa l'atrofia en una de les teves habilitats ja que et centres en una altra.

classFeature.name: Primal Champion
entries: A nivell 20, you embody the power of the wilds. Your Força and Constitució scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

subclassFeature.name: Sender dels Berserker
entries: Per algunes persones bàrbares, la fúria és un mètode justificada pels fins (on els fins és la violència). El Sender dels Berserker és un camí de fúria desbocada i tacada de sang. Quan entres en fúria et deixes endur pel caos de la batalla i et despreocupes de la teva pròpia salut o benestar.

subclassFeature.name: Frenesí
entries: Quan triïs aquest sender a nivell 3, pots tornar la teva fúria amb una de a. Si ho fas, mentre et duri la fúria pots, com a acció bonus a cada torn (excepte aquest), fer un sol atac melé armat. Quan acaba la teva fúria, reps un nivell d'{@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Fúria Eixelebrada
entries: Començant a nivell 6, no pots ser {@condition charmed} ni {@condition frightened} mentre estiguis en fúria. Si estàs {@condition charmed} o {@condition frightened} quan entres en fúria, l'efecte se suspèn mentre duri la fúria.

subclassFeature.name: Presència Intimidant
entries: Començant a nivell 10, pots, com a acció, acovardar a algú mitjançant la teva presència amenaçadora. Quan ho facis, escull una criatura que puguis veure a 30 peus d'abast. Ha de salvar per Saviesa (CD de 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Carisma). Si falla, està {@condition frightened} de tu fins el final del teu proper torn. Als torns posteriors, pots, com a acció, extendre l'efecte damunt la criatura {@condition frightened} fins el final del teu proper torn. L'efecte acaba si la criatura s'allunya més de 60 peus de tu o si trenca línia visual amb tu.
Si la criatura supera la salvada, no pots tornar-li a aplicar aquest tret durant 24 hores.

subclassFeature.name: Represàlia
entries: Començant a nivell 14, quan reps dany d'una criatura a 5 peus d'abast pots, com a reacció, fer un atac armat cos a cos contra aquella criatura.

subclassFeature.name: Ós
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, tens resistència a tot tipus de dany excepte dany psíquic. L'esperit de l'ós et dona prou força com per a aguantar qualsevol càstig.

subclassFeature.name: Àguila
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria and aren't wearing heavy armor, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attack rolls against you, and you can use the {@action Dash} action com a acció bonus en el teu torn. The spirit of the eagle makes you into a predator who can weave through the fray with ease.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Guerrers del Tótem
entries: The Path of the Guerrers del Tótem is a spiritual journey, as the barbarian accepts a spirit animal as guide, protector, and inspiration. In battle, your totem spirit fills you with supernatural might, adding magical fuel to your barbarian rage.
Most barbarian tribes consider a totem animal to be kin to a particular clan. In such cases, it is unusual for an individual to have more than one totem animal spirit, though exceptions exist.

subclassFeature.name: Llop
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, your friends have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of you that is hostile to you. The spirit of the wolf makes you a leader of hunters.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Seeker
entries: Yours is a path that seeks attunement with the natural world, giving you a kinship with beasts. A nivell 3 when you adopt this path, you gain the ability to cast the {@spell beast sense} i {@spell speak with animals} spells, but only as rituals, as described in {@book chapter 10|PHB|10|rituals}.

subclassFeature.name: Totem Spirit
entries: A nivell 3, when you adopt this path, you choose a totem spirit and gain its feature. You must make or acquire a physical totem object—an amulet or similar adornment—that incorporates fur or feathers, claws, teeth, or bones of the totem animal. At your option, you also gain minor physical attributes that are reminiscent of your totem spirit. For example, if you have a bear totem spirit, you might be unusually hairy and thick-skinned, or if your totem is the eagle, your eyes turn bright yellow.
Your totem animal might be an animal related to those listed here but more appropriate to your homeland. For example, you could choose a hawk or vulture in place of an eagle.

subclassFeature.name: Ós
entries: You gain the might of a bear. Your carrying capacity (including maximum load and maximum lift) is doubled, and you have advantage on Força checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

subclassFeature.name: Àguila
entries: Reps la vista d'una àguila. Pots veure-hi fins a 1 milla de distància sense difícultat; i pots veure els detalls més prims de les coses com si estiguessin a 100 peus o menys de tu. A més, la llum tènue no t'imposa desavantatge a les tirades de Saviesa ({@skill Perception}).

subclassFeature.name: Llop
entries: You gain the hunting sensibilities of a wolf. You can track other creatures while traveling at a fast pace, and you can move stealthily while traveling at a normal pace.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of the Bèstia
entries: A nivell 6, you gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice. You can choose the same animal you selected a nivell 3 or a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Walker
entries: A nivell 10, you can cast the {@spell commune with nature} spell, but only as a ritual. When you do so, a spiritual version of one of the animals you chose for Totem Spirit or Aspect of the Bèstia appears to you to convey the information you seek.

subclassFeature.name: Ós
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, any creature within 5 feet of you that's hostile to you has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you or another character with this feature. An enemy is immune to this effect if it can't see or hear you or if it can't be {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Àguila
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, you have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed. This benefit works only in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft.

subclassFeature.name: Llop
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, pots, com a acció bonus, en el teu torn to knock a Large or smaller creature {@condition prone} when you hit it with melee weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Harmonia Totèmica
entries: A nivell 14, reps un benefici màgic basat en l'animal totèmic que escullis. Pots triar el mateix animal que hagis triat abans o un de diferent.

subclassFeature.name: Sender dels Furiabatalla
entries: Els Furiabatalla també són coneguts com a Kuldjargh (els idiotes de la destral en Nannès) i són nans que segueixen els déus de la guerra. Solen vestir, {@item spiked armor|scag} pesada i aparatosa i es llencen a la batalla colpejant amb el seu propi cos enmig del caos de la batalla.

subclassFeature.name: Armadura Furiabatalla
entries: Quan esculls aquest sender a nivell 3, guanyes l'habilitat d'emprar la {@item spiked armor|scag} com a arma.

Mentre vesteixis {@item spiked armor|scag} i estiguis en fúria, pots, com a acció bonus, fer un atac armat cos a cos amb les punxes de la teva armadura a un objectiu a 5 peus d'abast. Si impactes, les punxes fan {@damage 1d4} de dany perforant. Pots emprar el teu modificador de Força per les tirades d'impacte i de dany.
A més, quan empris l'acció {@action Attack} per a apresar una criatura, l'objectiu rep 3 de dany perforant si superes la tirada de presa.

subclassFeature.name: Restricció - Només Nans
entries: Només els nans poden seguir el Sender dels Furiabatalla. Els furiabatalla formen una part molt específica de la societat i la cultura nanes.
El/la/li MM pot treure aquesta restricció si encaixa a la campanya. Aquesta restricció existeix pels Regnes Oblidats. Consulta-ho amb el/la/li MM.

subclassFeature.name: Temerarietat Total
entries: Començant a nivell 6, quan empris el tret Atac Imprudent mentre estiguis en fúria, reps punts de vida temporals equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (mínim d'1). S'esvaeixen si te'n queden quan acaba la teva fúria.

subclassFeature.name: Càrrega Furiabatalla
entries: Començant a nivell 10, pots, com a acció bonus, prendre l'acció {@action Dash} mentre estiguis en fúria.

subclassFeature.name: Retribució Punxeguda
entries: Començant a nivell 14, quan una criatura a 5 peus de tu t'impacti amb un atac cos a cos, l'atacant rep 3 de dany perforant mentre: estiguis en fúria; no estiguis {@condition incapacitated}; i vesteixis {@item spiked armor|scag}.

subclassFeature.name: Sender de les Bèsties
entries: Les persones bàrbares que segueixen el Sender de les Bèsties treuen la seva fúria de l'espurna bestial que tenen a l'ànima. La bèstia emergeix d'elles durant la fúria i les arriben a transformar físicament.
Potser els bàrbars tinguin un esperit primordial dins seu, o tal vegada descendeixin d'un canviaformes. Pots tirar l'origen del teu poder ferotge o triar-lo tirant a la taula Origen de la Bèstia.

entries.caption: Origen de la Bèstia
rows: Un dels teus pares és licàntrop i has heretat part de la maledicció.
Descèns d'un arxi-druida i has heretat el seu canvi de forma parcialment.
Un esperit fata t'ha regalat l'habilitat de canviar a formes bestials.
L'esperit d'un animal ancià t'habita, permetent-te seguir el sender.

subclassFeature.name: Forma de la Bèstia
entries: {@i 3rd-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

When you enter your rage, you can transform, revealing the bestial power within you. Until the rage ends, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add el teu modificador de Força to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it, as normal.
You choose the weapon's form each time you rage:

items.name: Bite.
items.entry: Your mouth transforms into a bestial muzzle or great mandibles (your choice). It deals {@damage 1d8} de dany perforant on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with this bite, you regain a number of hit points equal to el teu bonus de competència, provided you have less than half your hit points when you hit.

items.name: Claws.
items.entry: Each of your hands transforms into a claw, which you can use as a weapon if it's empty. It deals {@damage 1d6} de dany tallant on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you attack with a claw using the {@action Attack} action, you can make one additional claw attack as part of the same action.

items.name: Tail.
items.entry: You grow a lashing, spiny tail, which deals {@damage 1d8} de dany perforant on a hit and has the reach property. If a creature you can see within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack roll, pots, com a reacció, swipe your tail and roll a {@dice d8}, applying a bonus to your AC equal to the number rolled, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Soul
entries: {@i 6th-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

The feral power within you increases, causing the natural weapons of your Forma de la Bèstia to count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

You can also alter your form to help you adapt to your surroundings. When you finish a short or long rest, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you finish your next short or long rest:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you pot escalar superfícies difícils (incloent cap per avall pels sostres) sense haver de fer una tirada d'habilitat.
When you jump, you can make a Força ({@skill Athletics}) check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Fury
entries: {@i 10th-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

When you hit a creature with your natural weapons mentre estiguis en fúria, the beast within you can curse your target with rabid fury. The target must succeed on a Saviesa saving throw (DC equal to 8 + el teu modificador de Constitució + el teu bonus de competència) or suffer one of the following effects (your choice):

items: The target must use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see.
The target takes {@damage 2d12} de dany psíquic.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to el teu bonus de competència, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Hunt
entries: {@i 14th-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

The beast within you grows so powerful that you can spread its ferocity to others and gain resilience from them joining your hunt. When you enter your rage, you can choose a number of other willing creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (minimum of one creature).

You gain 5 punts de vida temporals for each creature that accepts this feature. Until the rage ends, the chosen creatures can each use the following benefit once on each of their turns: when the creature hits a target with an attack roll and deals damage to it, the creature can roll a {@dice d6} and gain a bonus to the damage equal to the number rolled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to el teu bonus de competència, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Wild Magic
entries: Many places in the multiverse abound with beauty, intense emotion, and rampant magic; the Feywild, the Upper Planes, and other realms of supernatural power radiate with such forces and can profoundly influence people. As folk of deep feeling, barbarians are especially susceptible to these wild influences, with some barbarians being transformed by the magic. These magic-suffused barbarians walk the Path of Wild Magic. Elf, tiefling, aasimar, and genasi barbarians often seek this path, eager to manifest the otherworldly magic of their ancestors.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Awareness
entries: {@i 3rd-level Path of Wild Magic feature}

Com a acció, you can open your awareness to the presence of concentrated magic. Fins el final del teu proper torn, you know the location of any spell or magic item within 60 feet of you that isn't behind total cover. When you sense a spell, you learn which school of magic it belongs to.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to el teu bonus de competència, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Surge
entries: {@i 3rd-level Path of Wild Magic feature}
The magical energy roiling inside you sometimes erupts from you. When you enter your rage, roll on the Wild Magic table to determine the magical effect produced.
If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Constitució.

entries.caption: Wild Magic
rows: Shadowy tendrils lash around you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitució saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} de dany necròtic. You also gain {@dice 1d12} punts de vida temporals.
You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns com a acció bonus.

An intangible spirit, which looks like a {@creature flumph} or a {@creature pixie} (your choice), appears within 5 feet of one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. At the end of the current turn, the spirit explodes, and each creature within 5 feet of ha de salvar per Destresa or take {@damage 1d6} de dany de força. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again, summoning another spirit, on each of your turns com a acció bonus.

Magic infuses one weapon of your choice that you are holding. Until your rage ends, the weapon's damage type changes to force, and it gains the light and thrown properties, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If the weapon leaves your hand, the weapon reappears in your hand at the end of the current turn.
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack roll before your rage ends, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} de dany de força, as magic lashes out in retribution.
Until your rage ends, you are surrounded by multi colored, protective lights. You gain a +1 bonus to AC, and while within 10 feet of you, your allies gain the same bonus.
Flowers and vines temporarily grow around you. Until your rage ends, the ground within 15 feet of you is difficult terrain for your enemies.

A bolt of light shoots from your chest. Another creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitució saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} de dany radiant and be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn. Until your rage ends, you can use this effect again on each of your turns com a acció bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Magic
entries: {@i 6th-level Path of Wild Magic feature}

You can harness your wild magic to bolster yourself or a companion. Com a acció, you can touch one creature (which can be yourself) and confer one of the following benefits of your choice to that creature:

items: For 10 minutes, the creature can roll a {@dice d3} whenever making an attack roll or an ability check and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll.

Roll a {@dice d3}. The creature regains one expended spell slot, the level of which equals the number rolled or lower (the creature's choice). Once a creature receives this benefit, that creature can't receive it again until after a long rest.

entries: You can take this action a number of times equal to el teu bonus de competència, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Backlash
entries: {@i 10th-level Path of Wild Magic feature}

When you are imperiled during your rage, the magic within you can lash out; immediately after you take damage or fail a saving throw mentre estiguis en fúria, pots, com a reacció, roll on the Wild Magic table and immediately produce the effect rolled. This effect replaces your current Wild Magic effect.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Surge
entries: {@i 14th-level Path of Wild Magic feature}

Whenever you roll on the Wild Magic table, you can roll the die twice and choose which of the two effects to unleash. If you roll the same number on both dice, you can ignore the number and choose any effect on the table.

subclassFeature.name: Sender de les Bèsties
entries: Les persones bàrbares que segueixen el Path of Bèstia draw their rage from a bestial spark burning within their souls. That beast howls to be released and bursts forth in the throes of rage.

Those who tread this path might be inhabited by a primal spirit or descended from shapeshifters. You can choose the origin of your feral might or determine it randomly by rolling on the Origen de la Bèstia table.

entries.caption: Origen de la Bèstia
rows: One of your parents is a lycanthrope, and you've inherited some of the curse.
You are descended from a legendary druid, a fact manifested by your ability to partially change shape.
A fey spirit gifted you with the ability to adopt different bestial aspects.
An ancient animal spirit dwells within you, allowing you to walk this path.

subclassFeature.name: Forma de la Bèstia
entries: {@i 3rd-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

When you enter your rage, you can transform, revealing the bestial power within you. Until your rage ends, you manifest a natural melee weapon, choosing one of the following options each time you rage:

items.name: Mossegada
items.entry: Your mouth transforms into a bestial snout or great mandibles (your choice). Your bite deals {@damage 1d8} de dany perforant on a hit. Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with your bite, you regain a number of hit points equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (mínim d'1 hit point).

items.name: Urpes
items.entry: Your hands transform into claws, which deal {@damage 1d6} de dany tallant on a hit. When you take the {@action Attack} action en el teu torn and make an attack with your claws, you can make one additional attack using your claws as part of the same action.

items.name: Cua
items.entry: You grow a lashing, spiny tail, which deals {@damage 1d12} de dany perforant on a hit and has the reach property.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Soul
entries: {@i 6th-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

The feral spirit within you grows in power, causing the natural weapons of your Forma de la Bèstia to count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

You can also call on the feral spirit to help you adapt to your surroundings. When you finish a short or long rest, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you finish a short or long rest:

items: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you pot escalar superfícies difícils (incloent cap per avall pels sostres) sense haver de fer una tirada d'habilitat.
When you jump, you can make a Força ({@skill Athletics}) check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious Fury
entries: {@i 10th-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

When you hit a creature with your natural weapons mentre estiguis en fúria, the spirit within you can curse your target with rabid fury. The target must succeed on a Saviesa saving throw (DC equal to 8 + el teu modificador de Constitució + el teu bonus de competència) or suffer one of the following effects (your choice):

items: The target must use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of your choice that you can see.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Call the Hunt
entries: {@i 14th-level Sender de les Bèsties feature}

The beast within grows so powerful that you can spread its ferocity to your allies. When you enter your rage, you can choose a number of willing creatures you can see within 30 feet of you equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (minimum of one creature). Until your rage ends, the chosen creatures gain the Reckless {@action Attack} feature and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. You also gain 5 punts de vida temporals for each creature that accepts the benefit. You can use this feature a number of times equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wild Soul
entries: The realm of the Feywild abounds with beauty, unpredictable emotion, and rampant magic. A barbarian exposed to this realm feels emotions powerfully and magic saturates their body.
When a barbarian who follows this path rages, it is a bellowing roar for freedom, an explosion of expression, manifesting in unpredictable ways.

subclassFeature.name: Lingering Magic
entries: A nivell 3, your body reacts to the presence of magic. You can cast the {@spell detect magic} spell without using a spell slot or components. Constitució is your spellcasting ability for this spell. You faintly glow a color corresponding to the school of magic you detect (you choose the colors).
You can use this feature a number of times equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Surge
entries: Començant a nivell 3, magic erupts from you as you rage. When you enter your rage, roll on the Wild Surge table to determine the magical effect produced.
If the wild surge requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Constitució.

entries.caption: Wild Surge
rows: Necrotic energy bursts from you. Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 1d10} de dany necròtic, and you gain punts de vida temporals equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt to the creatures.
You teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until your rage ends, you can activate this effect again on each of your turns com a acció bonus.

You conjure {@dice 1d4} intangible spirits that look like {@creature flumph||flumphs} in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of you. Each spirit immediately flies 30 feet in a random direction. At the end of your turn, all spirits explode and each creature within 5 feet of one or more of them must succeed on a Destresa saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} de dany de força.

Arcane energy enshrouds you. Until your rage ends, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, that creature takes force damage equivalent al teu modificador de Constitució.
Plant life temporarily grows around you: until your rage ends, the ground within 10 feet of you is difficult terrain.

Arcane energy taps into the minds of those around you. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Saviesa saving throw or you see a glimpse of the creature's thoughts, learning how it plans to attack you. As a result, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

Shadows weave around a weapon of your choice you are holding. Until your rage ends, your weapon deals psychic damage instead of its bludgeoning, slashing, or dany perforant, and it gains the light and thrown properties with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If you drop the weapon or throw it, the weapon dissipates and reappears in your hand at the end of your turn.

A beam of brilliant light lances from your chest in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Constitució saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} de dany radiant and be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Reserves
entries: A nivell 6, you can channel the magic surging inside you into other creatures. Com a acció, you can touch a creature and roll a {@dice d4}. The creature recovers an expended spell slot of a level equal to the number rolled. If the creature you touch can't recover a spell slot of that level, the creature instead gains punts de vida temporals equal to five times the number rolled.
You take force damage equal to five times the number rolled.
Quan arribes a nivell 14 in this class, you increase the die to a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Rebuke
entries: A nivell 10, the magic crackling within your soul lashes out. When a creature forces you to make a saving throw mentre estiguis en fúria, pots, com a reacció, deal {@damage 3d6} de dany de força to that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Chaotic Fury
entries: A nivell 14, you become a wellspring of wild magic mentre estiguis en fúria. Com a acció bonus, you can reroll on the Wild Surge table, replacing your current effect with the new one.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Magic Reserves
entries: A nivell 14, you increase your magic reserves die to a {@dice d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger on in the world as mighty spirits who can guide and protect the living. When barbarians who follow this path rage, they cross the barrier into the spirit world and call on these guardian spirits for aid.
Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians fight to protect their tribes and their allies. With the spirits' help, they can hinder their foes even as they strike powerful blows against them.

In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell epic sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Quan triïs aquest sender a nivell 3, spectral warriors appear when you rage. These warriors distract a foe you designate and hinder its attempts to evade you. Mentre estiguis en fúria, pots, com a acció bonus, en el teu torn to choose one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn or until your rage ends, the chosen creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you, and if the creature takes the {@action Disengage} action within 5 feet of you, its speed is halved until the end of its turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Shield
entries: Començant a nivell 6, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide protection for your allies. If you are raging and an ally you can see within 30 feet of you takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, pots, com a reacció, transfer your resistance to those damage types to the ally. The resistance applies to the incoming damage. Until the start of your next turn, the ally keeps the resistance and you lack it, unless you also have it from a source other than rage.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: A nivell 10, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. Right before you make an Intel·ligència or a Saviesa check, you can give yourself advantage on the check. You can use this feature three times, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: A nivell 14, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to strike your foes. When you or an ally you can see within 30 feet of you is damaged by a melee attack mentre estiguis en fúria, pots, com a reacció, cause the attacker to take {@damage 2d8} de dany de força from the spirits.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: Typical barbarians harbor a fury that dwells within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn instead to transform their rage into a mantle of primal magic that swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into nature to create powerful, magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect the natural realm. Other storm heralds hone their craft in elite lodges founded in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Fury
entries: When you select this path a nivell 3, choose one of the following options: desert, sea, or tundra. The environment you choose shapes the nature of the storm you conjure when you rage. Mentre estiguis en fúria, you emanate an aura in a 10-foot radius. The effects of this aura depend on your chosen environment.

entries.name: Desert
entries: Any enemy that ends its turn in your aura takes fire damage equal to 2 + your barbarian level divided by 4.

entries.name: Sea
entries: At the end of each of your turns, you can choose a creature in your aura other than yourself. The target ha de salvar per Destresa against a DC equal to 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Constitució. The target takes {@damage 2d6} de dany elèctric on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to {@dice 3d6} a nivell 10 and to {@dice 4d6} a nivell 15.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: Any enemy that ends its turn in your aura takes cold damage equal to 2 + your barbarian level divided by 4.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: A nivell 6, your link to the power of the storm grants you additional abilities based on the environment you chose a nivell 3.

entries.name: Desert
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage and don't suffer the effects of extreme heat.

entries.name: Sea
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage and can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: Tundra. You gain resistance to cold damage and don't suffer the effects of extreme cold.

subclassFeature.name: Shield of the Storm
entries: A nivell 10, you learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect your allies. Mentre estiguis en fúria, allies within your aura gain the benefits of your Storm Soul feature.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Storm
entries: A nivell 14, the power of the storm you channel grows mightier.

entries.name: Desert
entries: The ground around you becomes like shifting sand. Any enemy that attempts to move more than 5 feet per turn on the ground while in your aura ha de salvar per Força (DC 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Constitució). On a failed save, the creature's speed drops to 0 until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Sea
entries: Roaring winds tear through the area around you. Any creature in your aura that you hit with an attack ha de salvar per Força (DC 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Força) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: The air around you coldly slows your foes. The area within your aura is difficult terrain for your enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Zealot
entries: Some deities inspire their followers to pitch themselves into a ferocious battle fury. These barbarians are zealots—warriors who channel their rage into powerful displays of divine power.

A variety of gods across the worlds of D&D inspire their followers to embrace this path. Tempus from the Regnes Oblidats and Hextor and Erythnul of Greyhawk are all prime examples. In general, the gods who inspire zealots are deities of combat, destruction, and violence. Not all are evil, but few are good.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Fury
entries: Quan triïs aquest sender a nivell 3, you can channel divine fury when you start to rage. Si ho fas, you become cloaked in an aura of divine power until the rage ends. At the end of each of your turns for that duration, each creature within 5 feet of you takes damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your barbarian level. The damage is necrotic or radiant; you choose the type of damage when you gain this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Gods
entries: A nivell 3, your soul is marked for endless battle. If a spell would have the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster does not need material components to cast the spell on you.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Focus
entries: A nivell 6, the divine power that fuels your rage can shield you from harm. If you fail a saving throw mentre estiguis en fúria, you can instead succeed on that saving throw com a reacció. However, doing so immediately ends your rage, and you can't rage again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Presence
entries: A nivell 10, you learn to channel divine power to inspire zealotry in others. Com a acció, you howl in fury and unleash a battle cry infused with divine energy. Every ally within 60 feet of you gains advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rage Beyond Death
entries: Començant a nivell 14, the divine power that fuels your rage allows you to shrug off fatal blows.

Mentre estiguis en fúria, having 0 hit points doesn't knock you {@condition unconscious}. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until your rage ends.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian v2
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger on in the world as mighty spirits who can guide and protect the living. When barbarians who follow this path rage, they cross the barrier into the spirit world and call on these guardian spirits for aid.
Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians fight to protect their tribes and their allies. With the spirits' help, they can hinder their foes even as they strike powerful blows against them.

In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell epic sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Quan triïs aquest sender a nivell 3, spectral warriors appear when you rage. These warriors distract a foe you designate and hinder its attempts to evade you. Mentre estiguis en fúria, the first creature you hit with an attack en el teu torn becomes the target of these warriors. Until the start of your next turn or until your rage ends, that target has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you, and creatures other than you have resistance to the damage of the creature's attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Shield
entries: Començant a nivell 6, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide protection for your allies. If you are raging and a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction and reduce that damage by {@dice 2d8}. When you reach certain levels in this class, you can reduce the damage by more: by {@dice 3d8} a nivell 10 and by {@dice 4d8} a nivell 14.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: A nivell 10, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits and use them to scout far-off lands. When you do so, you cast the {@spell clairvoyance} spell, without needing a spell slot. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, the spell invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Saviesa is your spellcasting ability for the spell. After you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: A nivell 14, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to strike foes that dare harm those that you protect. When you use your Spirit Shield Ability to protect a creature damaged by an attack, the attacker takes the same amount of damage that the Spirit Shield protects.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger in the world as mighty spirits, who can guide and protect the living. When a barbarian who follows this path rages, the barbarian contacts the spirit world and calls on these guardian spirits for aid.

Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians can better fight to protect their tribes and their allies. In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Quan triïs aquest sender a nivell 3, spectral warriors appear when you enter your rage. Mentre estiguis en fúria, the first creature you hit with an attack en el teu torn becomes the target of the warriors, which hinder its attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that target has disadvantage on any attack roll that isn't against you, and when the target hits a creature other than you with an attack, that creature has resistance to the damage dealt by the attack. The effect on the target ends early if your rage ends.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Shield
entries: Començant a nivell 6, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide supernatural protection to those you defend. If you are raging and another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, pots, com a reacció, reduce that damage by {@dice 2d6}.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can reduce the damage by more: by {@dice 3d6} a nivell 10 and by {@dice 4d6} a nivell 14.

subclassFeature.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: A nivell 10, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. When you do so, you cast the {@spell augury} or {@spell clairvoyance} spell, without using a spell slot or material components. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, this use of {@spell clairvoyance} invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Saviesa is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
After you cast either spell in this way, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: A nivell 14, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to retaliate. When you use your Spirit Shield to reduce the damage of an attack, the attacker takes an amount of force damage equal to the damage that your Spirit Shield prevents.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: All barbarians harbor a fury within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn to transform that rage into a mantle of primal magic, which swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into the forces of nature to create powerful magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect nature. Other storm heralds hone their craft in lodges in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Aura
entries: Començant a nivell 3, you emanate a stormy, magical aura while you rage. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover.

Your aura has an effect that activates when you enter your rage, and you can activate the effect again on each of your turns com a acció bonus. Choose desert, sea, or tundra. Your aura's effect depends on that chosen environment, as detailed below. You can change your environment choice whenever you gain a level in this class.
If your aura's effects require a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + el teu bonus de competència + el teu modificador de Constitució.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Soul
entries: A nivell 6, the storm grants you benefits even when your aura isn't active. The benefits are based on the environment you chose for your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Shielding Storm
entries: A nivell 10, you learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect others. Each creature of your choice has the damage resistance you gained from the Storm Soul feature while the creature is in your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Storm
entries: A nivell 14, the power of the storm you channel grows mightier, lashing out at your foes. The effect is based on the environment you chose for your Storm Aura.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Zealot
entries: Some deities inspire their followers to pitch themselves into a ferocious battle fury. These barbarians are zealots—warriors who channel their rage into powerful displays of divine power.

A variety of gods across the worlds of D&D inspire their followers to embrace this path. Tempus from the Regnes Oblidats and Hextor and Erythnul of Greyhawk are all prime examples. In general, the gods who inspire zealots are deities of combat, destruction, and violence. Not all are evil, but few are good.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Fury
entries: Quan triïs aquest sender a nivell 3, you can channel divine fury into your weapon strikes. Mentre estiguis en fúria, the first creature you hit on each of your turns with a weapon attack takes extra damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your barbarian level. The extra damage is necrotic or radiant; you choose the type of damage when you gain this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Gods
entries: A nivell 3, your soul is marked for endless battle. If a spell, such as {@spell raise dead}, has the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on you.

subclassFeature.name: Fanatical Focus
entries: Començant a nivell 6, the divine power that fuels your rage can protect you. If you fail a saving throw mentre estiguis en fúria, you can reroll it, and you must use the new roll. You can use this ability only once per rage.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Presence
entries: A nivell 10, you learn to channel divine power to inspire zealotry in others. Com a acció bonus, you unleash a battle cry infused with divine energy. Up to ten other creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear you gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rage beyond Death
entries: Començant a nivell 14, the divine power that fuels your rage allows you to shrug off fatal blows.

Mentre estiguis en fúria, having 0 hit points doesn't knock you {@condition unconscious}. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until your rage ends, and you die then only if you still have 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria and aren't wearing heavy armor, your walking speed increases by 15 feet. The spirit of the elk makes you extraordinarily swift.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, you can add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance. The spirit of the tiger empowers your leaps.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: Whether mounted or on foot, your travel pace is doubled, as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated}. The elk spirit helps you roam far and fast.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills from the following list: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Stealth}, and {@skill Survival}. The cat spirit hones your instints de supervivència.

subclassFeature.name: Elk
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, pots, com a acció bonus, during your move to pass through the space of a Large or smaller creature. That creature must succeed on a Força saving throw (DC 8 + your Força bonus + el teu bonus de competència) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take dany contundent equal to {@dice 1d12} + el teu modificador de Força.

subclassFeature.name: Tiger
entries: Mentre estiguis en fúria, if you move at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a Large or smaller target right before making a melee weapon attack against it, pots, com a acció bonus, to make an additional melee weapon attack against it.

subclassFeature.name: Desert
entries: When this effect is activated, all other creatures in your aura take 2 fire damage each. The damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 3 a nivell 5, 4 a nivell 10, 5 a nivell 15, and 6 a nivell 20.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: When this effect is activated, you can choose one other creature you can see in your aura. The target ha de salvar per Destresa. The target takes {@damage 1d6} de dany elèctric on a failed save, ; si supera, en rep la meitat. The damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to {@dice 2d6} a nivell 10, {@dice 3d6} a nivell 15, and {@dice 4d6} a nivell 20.

subclassFeature.name: Tundra
entries: When this effect is activated, each creature of your choice in your aura gains 2 punts de vida temporals, as icy spirits inure it to suffering. The punts de vida temporals increase when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 3 a nivell 5, 4 a nivell 10, 5 a nivell 15, and 6 a nivell 20.

subclassFeature.name: Desert
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage, and you don't suffer the effects of extreme heat, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide. Moreover, com a acció, you can touch a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried by anyone else and set it on fire.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage, and you can breathe underwater. You also gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Tundra
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage, and you don't suffer the effects of extreme cold, as described in the Dungeon Master's Guide. Moreover, com a acció, you can touch water and turn a 5-foot cube of it into ice, which melts after 1 minute. This action fails if a creature is in the cube.

subclassFeature.name: Desert
entries: Immediately after a creature in your aura hits you with an attack, pots, com a reacció, force that creature to make a Destresa saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes fire damage equal to half your barbarian level.

subclassFeature.name: Sea
entries: When you hit a creature in your aura with an attack, pots, com a reacció, force that creature to make a Força saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}, as if struck by a wave.

subclassFeature.name: Tundra
entries: Whenever the effect of your Storm Aura is activated, you can choose one creature you can see in the aura. That creature must succeed on a Força saving throw, or its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn, as magical frost covers it.
